Fields.DialogueText: I bet you can't beat *this* one. It's the size of my fist.
Oh, I bet you I can. Here- feast your eyes.
Holy hell, that's huge!
So you agree? I have the better tattoos?
You have *terrifying* tattoos! Where did you find someone to put so many snakes on you? And bones, and- ew!
That's the point. I want to be formidable. Doesn't everyone?
What are you talking about?
Capitaine! We were comparing tattoos. Want to join us?

Fields.MenuText: I don't have any tattoos to compare.
You have so many, anyone would lose.
No. I don't like tattoos.

Fields.DialogueText: They're a fine naval tradition, Capitaine.
Thanks. I worked hard on them.
By the time you're done with me, you'll have a few.
*ALARM*
All right, let's move, people! You know what you have to do.
You remember who the Captain is here?
I do. *You* surely were told how I feel about that.
I wasn't, actually.
We will talk politics *after* this battle.
(Good grief, Belles and politics...)
@BATTLE
You said you wanted to talk politics?
You were the one who asked.
Mm. I asked if you remember who gives the orders around here.
And I counter: if the Morgana dies, does it matter who gives the orders?

Fields.MenuText: We need a clear chain of command.
Discipline is important in wartime.
I guess not. But that's not the point-

Fields.DialogueText: Do we, now. I can't help but notice that you did not give any orders, Capitaine.
I agree. But one can and *must* cultivate discipline for oneself. A leader cannot replace that.
If that's not 'the point', what is? We had a task. We completed it.
Someone needs to *lead*. A battle's too big to direct all on one's own.
That does not mean it has to be the same person every time, does it? Anyone aboard should be able to take command if the situation warrants it.
You really live up to your name.
Mm. "Terrible" as in "fearsome."
Is *that* why you're covered in tattoos out of a horror movie?
What's the matter, Capitaine? Are you scared of me?
Which part of you? The anarchism, or the tattoos?
Hah.
*ALARM*
Again? They're out in force today.
Let's force them back, then.
@BATTLE
So, Le Terrible... Have you got a moment?
I'm a little busy.
...Why are you lighting needles on fire?!
I am disinfecting them, Capitaine.
Your tattooing needles and piercing needles need to be disinfected. If you don't, the results are ... gruesome.
How gruesome are we talking?
The worst infections I have ever seen. And I am a medic.
Well, that sounds disgusting.
Mm. That is why we light them on fire. But you said you wanted to see me?
We've stopped at port to refuel.
Hm. What would we be watching, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: Snow White and the Seven Dwarves.
Aladdin and His Wonderful Lamp.
Pinocchio.

Fields.DialogueText: ... Ugh. I think I'll pass.
Eugh. No *thank* you.
You have to be joking, Capitaine! No, I would not.
Was it something I said?
*ALARM*
I'm not sure what's worse- the Morganas, or your taste in film.
Definitely the Morganas.
@BATTLE
Let's investigate *that* further.
And to pick up new weapons?

Fields.MenuText: I don't think we've got time for a refit. If you've got a wish list, though, we can go through it later.
I *do* like new weapons.

Fields.DialogueText: Don't make it sound so frivolous, Capitaine. It's life or death.
It has not escaped my notice.
Mm.
That said, we're trying to get our hands on a film for the crew. Any interest in catching a show?
Zut! Je ne crois-
... Le Terrible? What are you doing up at this hour?
Disinfecting the mess hall, Capitaine.
Disinfecting...? I didn't know you were so worried about hygiene.
I am giving myself a tattoo. I am going to repeatedly stab myself with a needle-
Less "hygiene" in general, more "avoiding blood poisoning."
Agh! Too much information.
Are you afraid of needles, Capitaine?

Fields.MenuText: No, I just don't need to hear you talk about getting stabbed.
A little. I'm working on it.
If you want a refit this badly, we can get you one without any needles.

Fields.DialogueText: Thank you, Capitaine. I'll take the refit *and* my tattoos.
The best treatment for fear is exposure.
*gulp*
That's a shame. I could tell you so many stories about my foremothers...
*ALARM*
Well, there goes *any* hope of getting this place clean.
We can try to keep them at a distance...
Everyone will be hungry after the battle.
Then maybe you should clean your cabin.
Not on your life.
@BATTLE
Oh, you're back. Did you enjoy yourself?
Yeah, the movie was great.
Hn. Glad you had a good time.
What's with that look? Did Disney kick your puppy?
In a manner of speaking.
... Wow, I didn't expect you to take that seriously.
Fairy tales are serious business.
Fairy tales? You didn't seem like the princess type.
This is *exactly* what I'm talking about, Capitaine. I did not say "princesses," I said "fairy tales."
I want my monsters, Capitaine. I want them shown in all their glory. Fangs and claws and all.
Fairy tales are about the dark wood and the wolf at the door, as much as the princess and the prince.
And this has ... what to do with Disney, again?
And these... these *American* animators, they take away all the *bite*.

Fields.MenuText: I thought Snow White was scary, for a kids' movie.
There's always monster movies.
It's terrible, seeing something you love profaned.

Fields.DialogueText: You understand! Yes, that's exactly how it feels. Profanation.
That's not the same thing, Capitaine. These new monsters, they're... creations of science. Or unnatural abominations.
There is a monster in everyone's heart. And its existence... should not be forgotten.
Again, you misunderstand!
Monsters are not the province of *children.*
You have *opinions* about monsters, huh?
Of course, Capitaine. I am one.
*ALARM*
Let's destroy these Morganas, non?
... Yes, let's.
@BATTLE
Talk to me, Le Terrible. What are you seeing?
I am not *seeing* anything, but I know... something horrible's coming.
... Something horrible?
Morganas. And not just any Morganas-
*ALARM*
We've got a visual on a fleet, Cap'! It's a big one. And the flagship- here, take a look.
....That thing looks like floating tetanus.
It's Disease, Capitaine. We should keep our distance.
I thought you didn't like it when people gave orders?
I don't. But this isn't an order. It's common sense.

Fields.MenuText: Hang back. We aren't equipped to deal with her.
Damn the torpedoes.
Close with her. We're going to blow her apart.

Fields.DialogueText: You're going to damn us all out of spite?
...If this is to be a fight, let's fight with caution.
Thank you, Capitaine.
Capitaine, she's sped up. She's going to ram us!
*Merde.*
We can't run! Let's fight her off before she crushes us.
@BATTLE
*Cough... cough... wheeze...*
Sato? Are you all right?
I ... don't feel well, kami-san.
You do *not* have to call me that. What's wrong?
It's... easier to say... *cough*
Understood. You look like hell warmed over.
I got stuck in the mist. But I was close to you... I thought I'd be ... *cough* fine.
... Damn those witches.
What's going on? Le Terrible?
Stay back, Capitaine. This is serious.
Sato- get to the med bay. Avoid other sailors as much as you can. Understand?
Yes, kami-san. I'm sorry-
This isn't your fault. But the lives of everyone aboard depend on you doing your duty, sailor.
Un- *COUGH*
Le *Terrible*. Status report.
We have an emergency. I hoped we'd sunk her quickly enough, but-

Fields.MenuText: What's the emergency? A sailor has a cold?
...Did Disease give us a plague?
Slow down. What are you saying?

Fields.DialogueText: You catch on quickly, Capitaine. Yes, she did.
I *hope* that's the worst of it. But we just fought *Disease*, Captain.
I am saying we must take all precautions.
There is a *very* real chance we have a plague aboard.
*ALARM*
... And another plague incoming.
Lucky for us you're a doctor.
@BATTLE
*COUGH, COUGH*
*HACK... WHEEZE...*
I take no pleasure in being right, Capitaine.
Never said you did.
This is madness. Everyone got sick overnight...
Mm. I assume you told the IF that we are now a floating Petri dish?
I did. And they gave us orders...
We're to return to the nearest port and transfer the infected troops to hospital.
... Non.
"Non?" Are you defying orders again?
I only defy *patently terrible* orders.
And this is on par with letting Disease chase us through a port.
You think we'll infect the port?
I don't "think." I am almost certain, Captain.

Fields.MenuText: Even if we're contagious, don't you think we need treatment?
This plague *does* seem to be spreading...
Do you think we could replace the infected crew?

Fields.DialogueText: While I will never say no to more help... it won't solve the immediate problem.
Like wildfire, Captain.
Yes, we do. But we need to avoid infecting civilians.
We need to quarantine. It's the only way.
*ALARM*
And if Command refuses to let us... well, damn them back to the hell they came from.
Ugh. Hope it's not Disease again.
If it is, we have bigger problems than my "insubordination," Captain.
@BATTLE
Le Terrible - about our current orders.
Are you going to defy them? I knew you'd see reason.
No. I'm going to modify them.
You're not wrong. We can't bring this infection into port.
So what is there to modify?
Our medics aren't equipped to handle this many sick people. They're overextended.
... I can handle it.

Fields.MenuText: You might be able to, but the rest of them are only human.
I don't doubt your capabilities, but...
Don't get cocky, Le Terrible.

Fields.DialogueText: I know my capabilities, Capitaine. Better than you seem to.
... But, you suspect that I am incapable.
My comrades are more than capable of treating this.
When was the last time you slept?
... I had a nap this morning.
You could drown a Morgana in your dark circles.
We have enough coffee aboard. I'll manage.
*ALARM*
.......... I'm too tired for this.
But not too tired to fight an entire plague on your own?
That's different, Captain.
I'm sure it is.
@BATTLE
... I have decided, Capitaine.
Oh? Should I be worried?
I have decided to follow the Fleet's recommendation and head for port.
Ah. So I *should* be worried.
Whyever should you be? You won.
This isn't about winning or losing.
Says the victor.
Urgh.
But we've had too many sailors fall ill. You were right.
Malheureusement, I cannot do the duties of a full hospital staff.
... No, and I'm glad you've stopped trying. But-
Are you *still* arguing with me, Captain? Will you continue to throw around your rank?
No, no. I was thinking, and I realized...
Mm?

Fields.MenuText: ... You were right.
... You made some good points.
... You didn't see the obvious compromise.

Fields.DialogueText: If it's so *obvious*, enlighten me.
Oh? Only *some* good points?
Glad to hear it. What changed your mind?
... You were right that we can't risk infecting an entire port city. I don't even want to *think* about what would happen if Disease penetrated the mainland.
But what if we had the doctors come out to us, instead of the other way around?
I think I see what you mean. Anchor a few miles away from shore and quarantine.
I've informed Command that that's what we'll do. Short of a direct order from them, we'll be docking off the coast and quarantining until this is over.
... Merci, Capitaine.
For what?
Trusting my judgment.
You have terrible judgement. But you're a medic, and I'm not.
Well, at least you trust me when it counts.
*ALARM*
I trust you to deal with this. Let's go!
@BATTLE
Positions, everyone! That's a damn big fleet.
Looks like the flagship is Disease, Capitaine.
That's the *last* thing we need.
I'm going to tear her throat out with my teeth.
GYAAAAAAAAAA-
Le Terrible, no!
Let- Go- Of- Me!
Ow! Why the hell'd you bite me?!
Hee hee hee. I can fix that for you, Captain.
Do not hold me back, Capitaine- I'm going to TEAR HER APART.
Just close your eyes... and let the rot set in...
TEAR- THE BITCH- TO SHREDS-
Oh, wouldn't that be nice. Hee hee. Sorry, but you'll have to wait.
I'm busy... giving your Captain so much lovely pus...
Keep your head, Terrible! We'll beat her- *cough*
@BATTLE
Thanks. You saved my bacon.
Do *not* thank me yet, Capitaine. We've got to drive her off.
No time like the present.
@BATTLE
Captain, back there...
Mm?
Why did you restrain me?
... From ripping Disease apart with your bare hands? I didn't want you to do anything you'd regret later.
I would not have regretted it.
Aren't you a *medic?*
That does not mean I am a pacifist, Capitaine.

Fields.MenuText: You're a medic and a *woman*.
There's a difference between shooting a Morgana and tearing her to pieces.

Fields.DialogueText: I take *great* pleasure in killing Morganas.

Fields.MenuText: I do too. But ... I didn't want you to catch something.

Fields.DialogueText: Oh. In the moment, I lost sight of that.
Do *not* call me that again, Capitaine.
Is there, really? At the end of the day, she is still dead.
A medic?
A woman.
But can't you do it cleanly?
I was angry enough I could barely see.
Capitaine, I will be blunt.
No.
I am not like most Belles. I do not have scruples about Morganas. I barely have them about humans.
If you try and appeal to my womanly sensitivity, you will find it does not exist.
How many times do I have to tell you? I am a *monster*.
Le Terrible... you're...
*ALARM*
It seems we have some fires left to put out, Capitaine.
Didn't you have some *orders* to give?
... Stations, people. We've got cleanup to do.
We need to talk.
About? Capitaine, I'm *very* busy.
You keep saying you're a monster. I wanted to make sure you weren't shell-shocked.
Hah! You're persistent, aren't you?
I care about my crew. And that includes my Belles.
... I see.
Capitaine, you have to look at this from a broader perspective.
I am a contre-torpilleur. I am equipped with twelve guns, each of which is perfectly capable of ripping a ship's hull open. To say nothing of your fragile human bodies.
I have filed my teeth to points and I am never without an entire collection of instruments which can bleed a grown man dry.
If your ancestors saw me coming- in either of my incarnations- they would *beg* me for mercy.
In what universe does that make me anything *but* a monster?

Fields.MenuText: You're not a bad person. I don't think you're a monster.
... I see your point, but...
All the Belles are like you, though. No one's going to call Maury a monster.

Fields.DialogueText: It's *very* funny, non? Maybe they *should*.
But what? But, because you like me personally, you think I'm not all bad?
Captain, please don't let your sentimentality blind you to the situation.
I just don't see why you're so attached to calling yourself evil. We need you-
The world needs monsters right now.
The world needs clear thinkers. Those who can see the world as it is, and react to it as it is. Without fear, without regret, and without mercy.
The world needs us to protect it. It needs us heavily armed today so that we can arm our comrades tomorrow.
... I just don't want you... hating yourself.
When did I say that, Captain? I am *proud* of my monstrousness.
I am proud of what I was, what I am, and what I can become.
*ALARM*
I believe you. But if you ever start to feel like you're... broken, or bad...
I promise you, Capitaine, you will be the first to know.
You *need* a monster in your corner right now.
Just don't tear anyone apart.
No promises.
@BATTLE
Hopeless! Hopeless, hopeless, hopeless!
What's the matter?
We're running low on *everything*.
Aspirin, eucalyptus oil, honey, medicinal cigarettes-

Fields.MenuText: Medicinal cigarettes?
It sounds like this has been hard on you.
So it *is* influenza?

Fields.DialogueText: Mm. Disease has given us her *loveliest* gift.
I don't remember the last time I slept, Capitaine.
For the treatment of coughs, Capitaine.
Urgh. I wish I could get my hands on some antibiotics.
They're so difficult to get one's hands on. Mass-production is the dream.
Well, aren't you glad we're going to port? We might get our hands on some there.
You are cruel as winter, Capitaine.
What? All I said was-
*ALARM*
Lucky for you, I will take it out on *them*.
"It"?
My rage.
@BATTLE
We made it. We're five miles out from shore.
Right. Time to raise the quarantine flag.
It's almost pretty, isn't it? That's a lovely shade of yellow...
Mm, it's what it means that's ugly. Give me a boost?
Here you go.
There. There's enough of a wind- we should be all right.
Ah, I'm tempted to raise the black flag along with it.

Fields.MenuText: You want to be a pirate?
Probably a bad idea. We *want* the medical team to come out here.
You have one lying around?

Fields.DialogueText: Who wouldn't, Capitaine?
This is true. I just get... wistful about it, sometimes.
In the eventuality we need it, yes.
You know, some pirate ships, back in the day... they were democracies? The crew would vote on any decision that was made, and the treasure was split equally between all members.
It was shipboard anarchy in its purest form.
They also killed innocent people for their treasure.
"Innocent?" They were conquerors. The despoilers of empire.
... Well, either way. Don't turn pirate until the Fleet medics get here.
I can wait that long, Capitaine.
*ALARM*
*They* can't seem to wait five minutes.
Let's give them what they want.
@BATTLE
This is the worst influenza epidemic I've ever seen. And I lived through '18.
Damn Disease back to the hell she came from.
Indeed.
I'd definitely recommend you don't dock. We'll send doctors out to you.
See, Capitaine? I was correct.

Fields.MenuText: You don't need to embarrass me in front of the inspector.
I'll concede on this one.
Yes. The Fleet made the right call.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll believe *that* if they give me more materiel to work with, Capitaine.
I'll see what I can do.
Oh dear. I can leave-
That won't be necessary. I did not mean to embarrass our *fearless* leader.
Thank you, Capitaine. I appreciate your ability to admit when you are wrong.
It's a rare gift.
*ALARM*
It's Disease again, Kanchou! What do we do?
Want to put it to a vote?
Just give the orders, Capitaine.
Protect the civilians. Keep your distance- and don't let her anywhere near the port!
@BATTLE
You heard the Capitaine. Let's move!
My dignity is bruised, Capitaine.
Mm? What's wrong, Le Terrible?
The new doctors are here and they are taking over my job.

Fields.MenuText: Isn't that what we wanted?
You *were* getting stretched a little thin...
That's terrible. We should report them to the proper authorities.

Fields.DialogueText: It is what *you* wanted! I can handle myself, Capitaine!
That's not the point. I know you worry about me, but-
You mock my pain, Capitaine, but *really.*
These doctors are the worst!
What's going on? Is there something I should know about?
One of these *connards* clearly bought his degree. And another has no bedside manner at all-
I'm sure you can't relate.
This is no laughing matter. *I* can be less coarse. And I believe my patients when they tell me something is wrong.
Will the doctors help you deal with the plague?
Yes, but they won't respect my recommendations.
If I put you in authority over them, do you think they'd listen to you?
... You are a crafty Capitaine, aren't you.
It was just a thought.
*ALARM*
I suppose I'll have time to *think* about it.
Don't think too hard. Focus on the Morganas.
Oui, Capitaine.
@BATTLE
Zzzz...
Le Terrible? Did you fall asleep?
Zzzz...
She fell asleep in the middle of her dinner. Poor thing must be exhausted.

Fields.MenuText: I could put my coat around her...
...or try and wake her up somehow.

Fields.DialogueText: Zzzz...
Zzzz...
There. She looks so peaceful asleep... like a completely different person.
Le Terrible? Le Terrible, wake up.
*ALARM*
Bzuh?!
Are you all right? You fell asleep in your soup.
I am *fine*, Capitaine. Where are the Morganas?
They're not in the dining hall, that's for sure.
You really have been working your ass off, huh?
Nn. Not important. Let's get on deck.
Right behind you.
@BATTLE
It's bizarre, Capitaine.
Hmm?
You put me at the top of the hierarchy of doctors, and suddenly, everyone is fawning over me.
Is that so?
Mm. They're pushing each other out of the way to do what I say.

Fields.MenuText: Don't let it go to your head.
Well, I'm glad they're getting in line.
I'm sure it must be a relief.

Fields.DialogueText: Believe me, Capitaine, that will be the *least* of your problems. I am not prideful, I am uncomfortable.
I'm not. It's *disturbing*.
Quite the reverse, Capitaine. It's... unsettling.
Why? You were so angry at the doctors for treating their patients badly. Now you can fix that.
I am uncomfortable for... philosophical reasons.
Is that so?
... To badly paraphrase Reclus, friendship and hierarchy cannot coexist.  You can have one or the other. Not both.
I see.
... I want *friends*, Capitaine. I want comrades I can trust with my life. That's as true in the operating room as on the battlefield.
I thought you thought these doctors were - what was the word you used?
Unprintable, Capitaine. But that's - that's the *point*.
I do not want to *force* these people to work with me. I want them to be better people.
... Well, good luck with that.
*ALARM*
... Morganas are easier. I don't have to befriend *or* control them.
Nope. Just bomb them to smithereens.
Easier done than said.
@BATTLE
We've just intercepted a radio message. There's another Morgana fleet coming. Probably five hundred clicks away.
Good work, Ghebali. We'll take it from here.
Pressures of *command* getting to you?
... This is a huge fleet.
We've seen bigger.
... It's a huge fleet, and Disease is the flagship.
And we're close to a port.
... Ah. I think I see. You're worried you won't be able to protect everyone.
Who wouldn't be? We've got the plague from Hell aboard as it is.
Imagine it spreading *off* our ship.
... That will not happen.
You're that confident you can hold her off?
... I am confident that I can destroy her. It is surviving the aftermath that is the problem.

Fields.MenuText: Just don't kill everyone aboard.
I can handle the strategy.
If we work together, I'm sure we can survive.

Fields.DialogueText: I'll try not to.
Of course you can, Capitaine. You wouldn't have survived this long if you couldn't.
I appreciate the optimism, Capitaine. Let's hope it's warranted.
Can I ask for a favour?
Of course. What is it?
This time? Don't hold me back.
We need to destroy her. Whatever it takes.
... I can't promise that. But I promise...  I won't order you back unless it's absolutely necessary.
I trust you. I know you need your autonomy and you don't do well with strict orders.
And I can give you both, if you need them.
So you *will* let me tear the bitch apart?
If it's the best course of action? Absolutely.
*ALARM*
Their vanguard, Capitaine. Be ready for more.
@BATTLE
Hee hee hee. You're looking healthy, Le Terrible...
Let's *fix* that!
Not on your miserable life!
Ugh- we're outgunned. All our gunners are down in the medbay.
Disease can kiss my-
*BOOM!*
Don't say that! She might *try* to.
Rrrrrrrgh!
Hee hee hee. Can't you feel it... your flesh, dropping away? Your hull, going to rust-
Don't you dare. Don't you *dare*-
You may harm me, you may sink me, but you will not lay a hand on my crew.
I don't need to. Hee hee.
Captain, I'm going to tear her limb from limb!

Fields.MenuText: Remember what we talked about?
It's too dangerous-
Go get her!

Fields.DialogueText: Not for me!
Yes - and I remember- I won that argument!
RRRRRRRAAAAAAGH-
(... Maybe I shouldn't have encouraged her. Goodness.)
Kanchou! Le Terrible pushed the Morgana over the side-
And they've both gone under! Should we do something?
Hold course. I think she has a plan-
I do! Focus fire on their flagship!
You heard the wom- you heard her! Target Disease!
@BATTLE
Never thought- *achoo!* - you'd be visiting me in the medical bay, Capitaine...
Me neither. How are you doing? You tackled a walking plague.
Oh, do not misunderstand. I am.

Fields.MenuText: Don't scare me like that.
You know what they say about old bold sailors...
After what I saw today? I'd believe you.

Fields.DialogueText: I will be *fine*. Drowning her was easy. It just meant- *COUGH*- it meant I had to touch her.
I guess no one is indestructible.
Hah. Even you can't deny the evidence of your eyes...
What? You think this is a joke?
It is lucky for all of us that I am a Belle, not a sailor.
I cannot die, Capitaine.
What makes you say that?
From a metaphysical perspective? You *cannot* kill righteous anger.
As long as the world is rotten inside, you need a monster to tear it apart.
Besides... they wouldn't let me die if I wanted to.
"They"?
The first ship named Le Terrible was built in the 1600s.
And you'll always tear the world open, as long as they give you the chance.
Exactly- *COUGH*
They will keep building ships named Le Terrible until... well... *la fin des haricots*.
There will always be a ship named Le Terrible. So I will always be here.
*ALARM*
Will you need me... on deck?
We'll be fine. Just get better.
I don't want me to prove you wrong, you unkillable monster, you.
Hah. Go, then.
But if you need me...
You'll be the first to know.
@BATTLE
And how are *you* feeling?
Eep! I'm- I'm fine, Kami-sama-
What? What's the matter?
N-nothing! Nothing! You're just- looking at me like you're going to eat me-
I'm not *that* kind of monster.
Hey, Le Terrible! Stop terrorizing the crew!
I am not *terrorizing* anyone. Simply doing a physical examination.
Oh? And what has your *examination* revealed?
The crew's mostly back to normal. Even the last few invalids will recover soon.
That's good to hear.
K-Kami-sama? Can I go now?
I am not your mother. Go where you will.
You definitely seem back to your old self.
Oui. This could have been much worse.
I do not want to think about what could have happened if we'd been unlucky. If there had been even a few more infected, or if she had been even a hair more virulent...
If only there was a way to dispatch her more efficiently.

Fields.MenuText: We'll be looking into new weapons.
Maybe we could try dousing her in penicillin?
You didn't seem too concerned with efficiency earlier...

Fields.DialogueText: I was angry and she was there.
...You know, that is not a bad idea. I will give it some consideration.
They don't *kill*. They only mangle until she is reborn.
*ALARM*
Looks like they've got a different flagship. That's a relief.
Let's not relax until she's dead.
@BATTLE
Looks like she really is gone for the time being.
Disease? Let's hope so. But I know she'll be back.
They never stay down for long.
Then neither will we.
Still... it *is* nice to know she's not dogging us. It means we can get back to the *important* things.

Fields.MenuText: Rebuilding the world?
Freeing the seas from Morganas?
Getting more tattoos?

Fields.DialogueText: Things like that, yes!
Long-term, yes. Short term...
Yes, eventually. Short term, though...
The important things in life are the simple pleasures, aren't they?
Getting more tattoos, yes... good food, good friends... telling the Admirals where they can shove their awful plans...
*ALARM*
Is tearing Morganas apart a 'simple pleasure'?
You know me so well, Captain.
@BATTLE
Le Terrible, I've been thinking...
Oh?
About how you keep calling yourself a monster.
This again, Capitaine? I'm not interested in arguing how I feel.
You can't talk me out of what I believe, any more than you could talk Provence out of her art obsession.
Oh, it's not that.
I'll take you at your word: you're a monster. But you're also a good person.
You want the world to be better so much that you're willing to tear it to pieces to get it there.
Capitaine, I...
You really believe that?
With all my heart. And I don't know how to convince you that you can be both, but...
... You make it easier to believe it.
If you weren't so... obsessed with hierarchy... I think we could be the best of friends.
Obsessed with hierarchy? That's a bit extreme, don't you think?
... You want me to know my place, do you not?
Below you.
That's not it at all. I... I want people to listen when I give orders, because it makes life simpler when things get messy.
I don't think you're less than me. Or below me. Or anything like that. You're our *Belle.*
Then prove it.
What?
Listen when I give advice. Treat me like I know what I'm talking about. When I'm the expert, do not undermine me.
I can do all that.
Friendship cannot exist within the confines of hierarchy. But if we can destroy that hierarchy... I'd be honoured to call you a friend.

Fields.MenuText: And I'd be honored to call you one.
Friends... or something more?

Fields.DialogueText: *Love* cannot exist within hierarchy either, Capitaine. There can be no love between master and servant-
Then it's settled. We'll be friends.
Oh, stop wiggling your eyebrows at me!
I'm sorry.
No, you're not. But I will accept your lack of apology.
I'm excited for that, Capitaine. Not sure if you can keep your promise... but excited.
My promise to take you seriously? Of course I will.
Time will tell.
No matter what happens between us... it's not going to look like anything 'normal'.
Never. In my perfect world, most 'normal' relationships would not exist.
Well, Le Terrible... I like the world you want to make. And someday... I want to live there too.
